storyInfo: Chilchuck dreams a strange dream in Sami, and at the same time, the will of Sami also tells Laios's party to head north and keep an eye out for the legendary Cyclopes. What could it all actually mean?

attributes.content: *rustle*, *rustle*—
A sudden noise interrupts Chilchuck from his dream.
Ever since he arrived here, even the slightest noise would stir him awake.
He fails to make sense of his dream and stands up, looking towards Laios, who is keeping watch.
Fortunately, the tallman who always loses his mind whenever talking about monsters is very reliable when facing a real one.
He has already awakened Senshi and Marcille, and has his weapon ready.
Chilchuck, we'll draw their attention while you scout them out.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Chilchuck discovers the sound came from a pack of monsters they've seen before, and they had yet to notice them.
He breathes a sigh of relief and returns to his companions with the news.

Since arriving in this world called Terra, the adventure party has seen too many strange sights. Though they often can't tell whether a creature is hostile or not, having faced monsters before at least gives them some idea of how to fight.
They exchange glances, and make sure everyone is ready for combat.
Alright, let's go!
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: As he charges, Laios can't help but think of all the dangers they'll need to avoid in this unknown world. Whether with the help of that Rhodes Island or relying on themselves, they'll have to return home.
Phew... it's finally over.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: I was having such a wonderful dream too. What a waste.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Considering how carelessly you spread out when you sleep, you must have wonderful dreams every day.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: I don't... Wait, I don't do that, do I?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: No, I was just making an educated guess.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: You know, we've been walking through this forest for a few days now.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Are there really Sami tribes living here?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: The Sami locals like to live in odd locations, and most aren't exactly welcoming of outsiders.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: So it won't be easy to find them.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: True... *sigh* I didn't think they'd live in such a remote place.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Weren't you the one who wanted to look for a snowpriest, Marcille? Are you giving up already?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Well, I didn't know this place would be so scary!
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: When we had just arrived in Sami, it looked so pleasant...
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: I heard all kinds of interesting stories, too. There was a small 'Basque Astrology' tent where they were telling fortunes.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: I mean, I did later find out she was a fraud controlling the crystal ball directly, but her story about the 'thousand-headed monster of Minoan myth' was still fascinating.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: I wonder if we could actually find it in Minos.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: I've also heard tales of a powerful monster that gains the abilities of whatever it eats.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: What an amazing ability…
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Of course that's the part that gets your blood racing.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Let's see if we can find a snowpriest before my legs completely give up on me...
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: If you're going to live as an adventurer, you must learn to adapt to your environment, Marcille.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: Well, don't worry about me adapting to this environment, because I'm never coming back here. Ever.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Thinking like that will only hinder your growth.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: I'd much rather trek through a place like this than stroll down a paved street.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: Look, I'm not saying we should give up on the snowpriest.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: But the fortune teller said we'd find them in the Myrkwood, and what have we found? Nothing!
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: It's dark, damp, there are just as many monsters as there are trees, and our supplies are nearly gone, which means you'll probably try to eat the monsters, again.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: What do you think, Laios?
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: Hmm... the ones we've run into so far don't seem all that different from the ones we've seen before. I thought we'd get to see some rarer monsters in here.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Forests don't give up their secrets that easily. We just haven't discovered them yet.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: Speaking of eating monsters, looks like the two of them are already carving one up. Isn't it great, Marcille? You're in for another treat.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: NO WAY ABSOLUTELY NOT NO NO NO!!!
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Another one?!
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Wha?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Looks like I got here too late.
And you are...?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Laios, you've got blood on your face! And don't greet people while holding that monster meat in your hand—
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Oh, it's fine.
I've seen much worse. Trust me.
You can call me Oakcup. I'm an apprentice shaman.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: A flock of fowlbeasts told me your location, so I hurried over.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Though, I'm sure you could have handled yourselves fine even without me.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh, please don't worry. I come with no ill intent. Seeing how well you're doing, I won't bother you any longer—
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Wait, did you just call yourself an apprentice shaman?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: We entered this forest hoping to find a Sami snowpriest to divine a way home for us. Or at least... to help us find Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: A way home?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Yeah. For whatever reason, we don't even know how to do that.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: As for Rhodes Island, a while back someone told us to look for them for help, but we haven't been able to find them.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: There are many in the south who are eager to 'guide' others.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh, we've met one of those. 'Basque Astrology.'
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Thanks to them, outsiders often come to the same misconception you have.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: We rarely predict the futures or wishes of others. We look into the future to ensure our own survival.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: We only request Samivilinn's guidance when absolutely necessary.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: We pray for Sami to warn us of any dangers ahead so we can prepare for them, but beyond that we live by the laws of nature.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Laws of nature?
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: No different from how you've been living.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Hunt or be hunted; Live and eat, or die and be eaten.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Aye, I knew I liked this place.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: ...I have a question.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Does your Sami show up in dreams?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Hmm... I haven't encountered it myself, but it's not entirely impossible to receive a revelation that way.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: After all, who can say if our dreams are true or false?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Did you have a dream about the future?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: ...Nope.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Alright, Mister Mysterious.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: So you won't be taking us to a snowpriest?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Hm... It's not that I'm unwilling to, but I'd find it quite troublesome.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Though, if you really do approach another tribe's shaman, they might just chase you off.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: What would take the least time and effort...?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Huh? Did the tree beside us just... drop two pieces of bark?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: There are strange runes on them, too... Which I can't read, of course.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Oh? Can I take a look?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Sure enough, Sami has sent you a guide.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Thank you, Sami. You sure have saved me a lot of trouble.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: What are these pieces of bark...?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Those are Foldartals. They represent Sami's will itself.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Shamans have many ways of glimpsing into the future, but sometimes, Sami will also proactively cast us a glance, just like this.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Sounds a bit too convenient to me.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: I think so too, sometimes.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: But on the other hand, wouldn't you have been even more frustrated if you couldn't find anyone to read these Fordartals for you?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: ...Why are you so casual about all this? Aren't you an apprentice shaman? Do you people not take your work seriously?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: I asked my teacher that once, and he answered by drinking wine out of my horns for the next two days. Never dared to ask again.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: So can you tell us what's on them?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The first one... 'North'?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: You mean we should head north?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: You're already northward bound, but Sami still says 'north.'
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Perhaps It wants you to go even further north.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Even further? What's up there, Chilchuck?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: The map says that once you leave the Myrkwood, you'll be in the center of Sami's forest. Further north of that are the huge snow-covered mountains and the endless icefields.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Don't tell me Sami wants us to go to the icefields?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Samivilinn often only casts a vague image.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: But if you were to ask me, I'd say so, yes.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: The endless icefields? I asked around about them, and that's not the kinda place you return from.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: But you just said earlier that you don't know how to get home.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: An undiscovered path hidden in a place from which none have returned. Perfect, no?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: As for the other piece... 'Hermit.' Haha. Interesting.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: And what does that mean?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: It can mean many things... but if you're talking about a 'hermit' in the 'north,' then there's really only one thing it could be referring to.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The Cyclopes.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: THE WHAT?!
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: You know of the Cyclopes?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I... heard about them when I was gathering information.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: What kind of monster is that?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Um... no, they're a special kind of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: They use a completely different way to tell the future than we Sami do.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: And they just happen to live in seclusion, deep within the mountains to the north.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Put the two Foldartals together, and I think this is what Sami is trying to tell you:
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Go northward to ask the Cyclopes for help. They will assist you in finding your way home, or so I believe.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I think I'm willing to give it a shot. What about you guys?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: If there's a chance, we might as well take it.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: ...If it really works out, I suppose I'll go along.
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Chilchuck?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: The three of you already agreed to go, so is there any point in asking me?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Of course there is, you're a member of our party too.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: ...I'll be honest then.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: I'm against it.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Do you not trust Oakcup?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: That's not it. I can tell he's not lying.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Then why not?
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Prophecies, divination... you guys are way too willing to believe that stuff.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: What if someone planned this all out? Dropped two pieces of bark here and is trying to cheat us? Again?
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: He has a point. But I still think there's no harm in heading north a bit further.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: If we run into another shaman, we just have to ask them to read the bark and we'll know if Oakcup was telling the truth or not.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: We've been here for a while now, so I wouldn't want to miss even a chance of finding a way home.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: ...Fine.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Speaking of going north though, why do I feel like we've been wandering around in circles this whole time?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Haven't we already walked past here before?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: ...I made some markers. I'm sure we've been making progress.
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: What's wrong, Chilchuck?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Senshi's right. But the terrain here is making me feel uneasy.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Like the land itself has been shifting the whole time...
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: You mean like the dungeon?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Yeah, something like that. But while the dungeon is always changing on the inside, this place is... the entire forest seems to be changing.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: Look, there's a cliff up ahead. I'll go scout the terrain.
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: What was that?
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: The four look towards the source of the sound, and see a monster resembling a bull.
—Of course, they know by now to call it a 'hornbeast.'
A creature showing up in the forest should be a common sight, but this hornbeast has still drawn their attention... For one reason—
On its face is a black... black? No, it is a blank, an endless void.
The first thing that comes to mind is the galaxy of stars one can see in the night sky.
A cow with a void as its face. They find this reality hard to believe.
What's even more shocking is what lies dead center in the blank space. A circle.
An uncannily perfect circle.
A circle somehow even darker than the void surrounding it.
Darker than the night, deeper than the void.
But how can this dark circle seem to emit light?
Because it isn't. The circle is really a hole that sucks in all the light near it, to the point that it seems to be glowing.
Darker than the night, brighter than the light...
Well... this is a strange monster.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: The void on its face doesn't seem to be part of its usual biology.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Fascinating. I really want to study it.
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: (Howls)
attributes.name: Corrupted Hornbeast

attributes.content: Sounds like it's angry!
attributes.name: Chilchuck

attributes.content: There are wounds on its body, from weapons... Someone's riled it up, and now it thinks we're the enemy!
attributes.name: Senshi

attributes.content: Eat my axe!
(Pained howl)
attributes.name: Corrupted Hornbeast

attributes.content: Wow does that girl have a ton of weapons...
attributes.name: Marcille

attributes.content: Damn, the cliff's collapsing! Chilchuck!
attributes.name: Laios

attributes.content: Laios immediately sprints towards Chilchuck on the cliff, but is one step too late—
Chilchuck tries to jump backward to catch the outstretched hand, but Laios fails to grab him and can only watch as the Half-foot falls off the cliff.
